events.name: Inaugural session of Google Cloud Meetup.  Talks and pizza at Google Cambridge
events.description:
In this session, we'll learn, meet one another, and figure out what we want this meetup to be.  Preliminary agenda:

6:00 PM - Pizza, socializing

6:25 PM - Introduction (Dan Belcher, Google Cloud PM)

6:30 PM - GCP at the Broad Institute (Lukas Karlsson, Broad Institute)

7:00 PM - Highly Available File Storage with Gluster on Google Cloud (Jeff Darcy, Red Hat)

7:20 PM - Google Cloud Datalab Use Case:  Time Series Data (Vas Bala, Google Cloud Engineering)

7:40 PM - Closing, agenda for next session

Google will provide pizza and soft drinks.

Location:

Our entrance is located at 325 Main Street, Cambridge MA, 02142, between Legal Seafoods and the MIT Coop in Kendall Square. 

We are located on the Kendall Square red line T-stop. Street parking is available on Main Street and Ames Street, and garage parking is available at 4 Cambridge Center (accessible via Broadway). 

**Please note: This is a secure facility. Your full name is required for entry into the Google building. If for some reason you do not update the invite with your full name, you will be unable to join.**  Thank you for your cooperation.

events.name: Google Cloud Boston User Group September Meetup, Hosted by mabl
events.description:
Validating 100 Million Pages a Month with
Kubernetes @ mabl

26 Sept 2017

Testing millions of web pages monthly requires rapid resource allocation, runtime isolation, and auto scaling. At mabl we’ve harnessed Docker containers and Google Container Engine to run a large number of concurrent container instances on Kubernetes to power our autonomous test cloud.

We’ll discuss our GCP Kubernetes architecture, from slick features to rough edges, Docker containers, CI/CD, Google Stackdriver monitoring, and auto scaling. We’ll demonstrate how we continuously build test, deploy, and scale the mabl cloud.

Mike Bartucca (@MikeBartucca), Software Engineer at mabl, former Googler, and Stackdriver
alumnus.

Joseph Lust (@lustcoder), Software Engineer at mabl, erstwhile MC10 lead, MDDetails.com and RunPartner.com co-founder, and blogger.

Venue:
mabl, 141 Tremont St, 6th floor, Boston, MA 02111

Entrance on Temple St @ intersection w/ Tremont

Agenda:

6:00-6:30 pm Meet and greet over burritos and beer
6:30-7:15 pm Presentation start
7:15-7:30 pm Intermission / Networking
7:30-8:10 pm Presentation demos and discussion 

Thanks to mabl for sponsorship and hosting.

events.name: Google Cloud Boston User Group November Meetup, Hosted by Google

venue.name: Google Cambridge - Ada Lovelace Tech Talk Room

events.description:
Lightning Talks:

Distributed Counting with Dataflow by Geoff Cooney of mabl 

Counting in a highly distributed, scalable system can be surprisingly hard.  See an overview and hands on example of how you can use Google Dataflow to generate reliable real-time metrics at scale.

Incorporating Online User Feedback with Cloud ML by John Kinnebrew of mabl 

Incorporating direct user feedback on machine learning results can improve personalization and efficacy, but online learning or immediate model re-training is not always feasible.  We discuss how mabl combines Google Cloud ML-Engine, Dataflow, and Datastore to handle the gap between when a user provides feedback and when retrained models are deployed.

Keynote:

The Ins and Outs of GCP Billing at Scale by Lukas Karlsson of the Broad Institute  

Topics include:

• creating and managing Google Billing Accounts and Subaccounts (resellers) • viewing your billing information in the admin console
• exporting billing data to CSV, JSON, or BigQuery
• viewing/analyzing billing data with DataLab and DataStudio
• Orbitera and third party tools

Lukas Karlsson is the Cloud Architect and Developer Advocate at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, where has been supporting scientific research for the last 14 years. Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard was launched in 2004 to improve human health by using genomics to advance our understanding of the biology and treatment of human disease, and to help lay the groundwork for a new generation of therapies.

Venue:
Google, 325 Main St, Cambridge, MA 02142

Entrance on Main St near Kendall Station. Get badges from registration desk in the lobby through the double doors next to Beatnik Beverages that is labeled 325 Main Street. 

Agenda:

6:30-7:00 pm pm Meet and greet over food
7:00-7:30 pm Lightning Talks
7:30-8:30 pm Lukas Keynote Presentation start

Thanks to Google for sponsorship and hosting.
events.how_to_find_us: 325 Main St lobby, Cambridge, MA for badges

events.name: Google Cloud Boston User Group January Meetup, Hosted by the Broad Institute
events.description:
Details:

Get together with fellow Boston area Google Cloud Platform practitioners to share cloud experiences and learn from others.

Topic 1:

Puppet and Terraform at Scale on GCP

Andrew Teixeira will explain how The Broad Institute harnesses Puppet and Terraform to control the hordes of machines that crunch genetic information at scale on GCP. Andrew works in DevOps at The Broad Institute
linkedin.com/in/andrewteixeira

Topic 2:

Building Event Driven Serverless Microservices with Cloud Functions and PubSub

Joseph Lust, details the queue driven, decoupled microservice architecture which drives the highly scalable backend @ mabl. Processing nearly 200M events per month for the price of an MBTA pass. Learn the details of composing Node based Cloud Functions with events from Cloud Storage, PubSub, and HTTP endpoints into a coherent, serverless system that transparently scales.

Joseph (@lustcoder) is an engineer @ Boston based mabl

Venue:

Broad Institute, 415 Main St, Cambridge, MA 02142

Use entrance near the corner of Main St and Galileo Galilei Way. Ask front desk for directions to the Monadnock room.

Agenda:

6:30-7:00 pm - Meet and greet over food
7:00-7:45 pm - Talk 1: Puppet/Terraform @ Broad
7:15-8:30 pm - Talk 2: Decoupled Serverless on GCP

Thanks to the Broad Institute for sponsorship and hosting.
events.how_to_find_us: Use entrance near Main St and Galileo Galilei Way

events.name: GDG Cloud Boston April Meetup, Hosted by the Broad Institute
events.description:
Get together with fellow Boston area Google Cloud Platform practitioners to share cloud experiences and learn from others.

Recap:

What's in a Name: GDG Cloud Boston

A lot has happened since Lukas & Joe attended the Google Cloud Community Conference. Joe will discuss the changes over the last month for the erstwhile Boston Google Cloud Meetup. We'll recap the new meetup name, new communications tools for the meetup, results from last month's meetup member survey, and the direction for 2018.

Joe (@lustcoder) is an engineer @ Boston based mabl

Topic 1:

Efficiency through Interactive GCP Commandline Tools

Lukas Karlsson will discuss and demonstrate the new features of the gcloud interactive shell and how to setup and use these, and other recent enhancements to the GCP tool for greater productivity. These improvements touch many tools such as gcloud, gsutil, bq, and kubectl.

Lukas Karlsson is the Cloud Architect and Developer Advocate at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, where has been supporting scientific research for the last 14 years. Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard was launched in 2004 to improve human health by using genomics to advance our understanding of the biology and treatment of human disease, and to help lay the groundwork for a new generation of therapies.

Venue:

Broad Institute, 415 Main St, Cambridge, MA 02142

Use entrance near the corner of Main St and Galileo Galilei Way. Ask front desk for directions to the Yellowstone room.

Agenda:

6:30-7:00 pm - Meet and greet over food (Upper Crust Pizza!)
7:00-7:10 pm - Recap: What's in a Name: GDG Cloud Boston
7:10-7:55 pm - Talk 1: Efficiency through Interactive GCP Commandline Tools

Thanks to the Broad Institute for sponsorship and hosting!
events.how_to_find_us: Use entrance near Main St and Galileo Galiliei Way. Yellowstone conf room

events.name: Cloud Next `18 Extended - Boston
events.description:
Cloud Next 2018 was a jam packed event with 27,000+ attendees. This meetup will condense the myriad announcements and dive deep into some of the 440 plus detailed breakout sessions. Freshly back from presenting @ Next, Lukas and Joe will cover the meteoric progress in Google Cloud Platform so far in 2018 and how it enables and improves your GCP development projects.

Agenda:

5:30pm-6:00pm - Meet & greet with food and drinks
6:00pm-7:30pm - Cloud Next 2018 recap with Lukas & Joe
7:30pm-8:00pm - Breakout questions about Next and your projects

Please bring any additional question or topics you would like to discuss. The goal of this Extended event is to bring everyone up to date with the cornucopia of new features and previews released and announced in the last two weeks to help you maximize your GCP productivity and efficiency.
events.how_to_find_us: Just ask the front desk for the GDG Boston Cloud Meetup

events.name: Google Cloud Platform Certification and Training
events.description:
GDG Cloud Boston Meetup #9 - September 13, 2018

"Google Cloud Platform Certification and Training"

Abstract:

Google offers 3 certifications to demonstrate proficiency on Google Cloud Platform.

 Associate Cloud Engineer
 Professional Cloud Architect
 Professional Data Engineer

In this session, we will discuss the value of these certifications, help you decide which of them to pursue and discuss training resources to help you.

Resources to be covered include

 Coursera
 Qwiklabs
 Google Codelabs
 Instructor-led training

In the hands-on portion of the session, we will assist anyone interested in setting up a free GCP Trial account, a Qwiklab account and Coursera account. Bring your notebook computer or chromebook to participate in the hands-on activities. In order to create a GCP Trial account, you must have a gmail account (either one that you use for email or we recommend
a separate one) and you must supply a credit card number (but you will not be billed without your explicit approval at the end of the trial.) We will also be encouraging use of 2FA using a hardware key or Google Authenticator and will demo these.

Who Should Attend:

Anyone with an interest in improving skills on GCP related to cloud
architecture, data engineering, or app development and anyone interested in getting one of the 3 named certifications. (There are also Gsuite certifications that we will not be covering.)

What you will Learn:

We will help you identify your training objectives and help you design a
learning path to achieve these objectives. If you participate in the hands-on session you will have a GCP trial account with $300 credit for GCP resources. You will know how to run Qwiklabs and identify which labs you want to run. You’ll have a Coursera account and an overview of the GCP-related courses there.
events.how_to_find_us: Enter from the 75 Ames Street entrance and proceed to the 2nd floor. Follow signs for Yellowstone Room.

events.name: Cloud OnBoard Boston
events.description:
Cloud OnBoard

Google Cloud Platform Fundamentals: Core Infrastructure

October 9, Boston

InterContinental Boston
510 Atlantic Ave
Boston, MA 02210

REGISTER HERE:
https://cloudplatformonline.com/Onboard-Northam.html?location=boston

Start_Training {
Learn how to Build
What’s Next with Google
}

Cloud OnBoard is a free, instructor-led training event, that will provide you with a technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of presentations and technical demonstrations, you will learn how to get started with virtual machines, containers, applications, big data, and machine learning.

Core Infrastructure

* Google Compute Engine, Storage, Datastore, Kubernetes®, and more

Who should Attend?

* Solution architects, software developers, systems operations administrators

Schedules () {

09.00 AM - 05.00 PM

Registration

Module 1: Introducing Google Cloud Platform

Module 2: Getting Started with Google Cloud Platform

Lunch

Module 3: Virtual Machines in the Cloud

Module 4: Storage in the Cloud

Module 5: Containers in the Cloud

Break

Module 6: Applications in the Cloud

Module 7: Developing, Deploying, and Monitoring in the Cloud

Module 8: Big Data and Machine Learning in the Cloud

Closing Session: Containers in the Cloud

}

events.name: IoT in Action: Smart, Connected Products (Google Cloud Talks: Cambridge)
events.description:
[Note: For this Google Cloud event, separate registration is needed, see below. RSVP on this page is not sufficient.]

GDG Cloud Boston invites you to join Google Cloud at:

Event: Google Cloud Talks: Cambridge

Title: IoT in Action: Smart, Connected Products

Registration Required

https://cloudplatformonline.com/Cambridge-Talks-Series-Talk1-Reg.html

New "Cloud Talks" Series

Next Wednesday (11/28), Google Cloud invites you to join us for an entirely new program in the Cambridge/Boston area. Our new Google Cloud Talks series is built for Cloud users to learn and network after hours. Each month, we’ll bring together a community of IT practitioners at our Google offices to discuss key features of Google Cloud with our Customer Engineering experts. We’ll dive into the products, tools, and new features that matter most to your career as you modernize IT with Google Cloud.

Summary

Nobody has an IoT problem. Many people have a business problem which can be solved in whole or in part through the use of IoT technology. In this session, we'll leave the world of Raspberry Pi behind and talk about how Smart Connected Products are working to solve current business problems that are all around us. We’ll also explore how Google Cloud’s IoT tools and scalability make it the most flexible choice for your IoT solution.

Agenda

6:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Check-in and refreshments
6:30 PM - 7:45 PM - Welcome address and presentation
7:45 PM - 9:00 PM - Reception and networking

Speakers

Kevin Holbrook, Cloud Customer Engineer

Kevin Holbrook is a Cloud Customer Engineer who has spent the last 10 years working the IoT space (or ”M2M” as we used to say back in the day). Kevin has worked on dozens of Industrial IoT projects that are currently deployed in the field, and he also works with startups in the IoT space. Here at Google, he is focused on helping customers to solve real business problems with real-world technology.

Location

Google Campus, 355 Main St, Cambridge, MA

events.name: GDG Cloud Boston December Meetup
events.description:
[Date is confirmed. Location has changed, but it is still on the T.]

Join us to hear Philipp Maier of Google Cloud talk about GCP networking.

Consider for a second the impact Google Search has on our daily lives with timely and relevant responses. Now, think of other Google products – Gmail, Maps, Chrome, YouTube, Android, Play. Each of these products has over 1 billion monthly users. Google had to develop networking technologies to meet the requirements of a distributed computing infrastructure that can support those billions of users. Google Cloud’s goal is to share these innovations and infrastructure with others so that they can also impact and delight their users.

Philipp Maier will discuss GCP networking at both introductory and advanced levels, highlighting the strengths of using state-of-the-art software-defined networking and distributed systems technologies, such as Virtual Private Cloud networks, and global Load Balancers. Advanced features covered will include Network Service Tiers, and several interconnect options that are useful in hybrid and multi-cloud architectures.

Should you desire formal training on GCP networking, you'll be in good hands. Philipp is the author and instructor of the new Coursera Specialization "Networking in Google Cloud Platform" Several options for taking these courses will be recommended.
https://blog.coursera.org/launch-your-career-in-cloud-networking/

Hosted at mabl

5:30 Doors open
6:00 Food and announcements
6:30 Talk by Philipp Maier
7:30 Q&A Session
8:00 Networking and wrap-up

Notes:
1. Bring you laptop or notebook computer. There will be a hands-on session toward the end of the evening. It will be helpful to have a GCP Trial account already established, and have the GCP SDK installed. If you want help with those items, please ask us.
2. Parts of this session will be recorded. This is experimental, so we can't promise that a recording of the entire event will be available. It is something we are moving toward for future sessions.
events.how_to_find_us: MBTA is the best option. Parking in the area is limited and often expensive.  Pro Tip: The entrance to 141 Tremont St. is actually on Temple Place, to the right of Herrera's. See attached photo.

events.name: GDG DevFest OnAir
events.description:
Join GDG DevFest OnAir - December 11th, 12pm EST (YouTube)

We’re excited to announce the first official DevFest OnAir! DevFest OnAir is an online conference featuring sessions from DevFest events around the globe. These community-led developer sessions are hosted by GDG (Google Developer Groups) focused on community, networking and learning about Google technologies. With over 500 communities and DevFest events happening all over the world, DevFest OnAir brings this global experience online for the first time!

REGISTER: https://g.co/dev/festonair18

#devfestonair18 #googlecloudplatform

Benefits of Watching:

Exclusive content.

DevFest OnAir includes exclusive content from Google. Switch between three separate tracks: Cloud; Mobile; Voice, Web & more. Sessions cover multiple products such as Android, Google Cloud Platform, Firebase, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and mobile web.

Tailored to your time zone.

Anyone can join, no matter where you are. We’re hosting three broadcasts around the world, around the clock, so there’s a convenient time for you to join no matter where you are at home or at work.

Ask us a question live.

Our live Q&A forum will be open throughout the online event to spark conversation and get you the answers you need.

Fun!

Join the fun with interactive trivia during DevFest OnAir where you can receive something special! Every participant will receive one free month of learning on Qwiklabs.

Join us to socialize and talk tech @ our reserved pool tables and enjoy food and drinks.

events.name: GDG Cloud Boston January Meetup - Image Analysis and Training @ Scale w/ GKE
events.description:
Image Analysis and Model Training @ Scale on GKE

Seasoned ML developer, Sergei Makar-Limanov Ph.D. has built ML implementations at TripAdvisor, LevelUp, CNet, and most recently mabl.

Sergei will present how to build an online image analysis and training pipeline at scale on GCP, using an entirely serverless architecture. He'll discuss the use of Google Kubernetes Engine to cost effectively train and retrain models at scale over millions of images using GCP features like preemptible VMs. The challenges and benefits of combining the training pipeline into a real time, serverless training/prediction system with Cloud Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Functions, MemoryStore, and BigQuery will also be detailed.

Hosted at the Broad Institute

5:30 Doors open
6:00 Food and announcements (Boloco burritos and chips!)
6:30 Talk by Sergei Makar-Limanov Ph.D.
7:15 Q&A Session

Notes:
1. Parts of this session will be recorded. This is experimental, so we can't promise that a recording of the entire event will be available. It is something we are moving toward for future sessions.
2. The food selection will include a number of vegetarian burritos, but supplies will be limited to a first come, first served basis
events.how_to_find_us: Enter from the 75 Ames Street entrance and proceed to the 2nd floor. Follow signs for Yellowstone Room.

events.name: Dealing with Data in an open multicloud environment: An intro to Netapp CVS
events.description:
Bryan Wagoner is a Cloud Architect within the Cloud Data Services unit of Netapp with a focus on GCP. He is a veteran of startup companies with 22 years perspective on the technology industry.

Bryan will present ideas on how to build large multicloud fabrics and avoid vendor lockin.

Users migrating enterprise apps to GCP, anyone dealing with cloud storage or spend issues, analytics apps, or anyone wanting an open multicloud strategy will be especially interested.

Schedule:

5:30pm - Arrive, socialize, food (Boloco)
6:30pm - Presentation
6:15pm - Q&A
7:30pm - Finish

Presentation Summary:

NetApp Vision of creating pan-global IOT/Analytic fabrics using Kubernetes, serverless, and building data fabrics

The world is rapidly changing and consumers need a way to utilize multiple public cloud provider services in conjunction with their own Datacenter resources, seamlessly, while avoiding lock-in to any one provider. NetApp believes that Kubernetes, Service Mesh, Serverless, and a data fabric is a major first step to realizing pan-global fabrics of IOT, Analytics, and the borderless software defined datacenter.

CVS on GCP overview & Use cases

NetApp and Google Cloud formed a strategic alliance to provide a tightly integrated, self-service, multiprotocol file service offering on GCP with superior performance. Cloud Volumes Service allows customers to migrate/build apps with massive IOP and Bandwidth requirements at a low cost price point that enables workloads on GCP that are otherwise too expensive to move or build. CVS is built to look and feel like a google native service through partnership with google.

Cloud Sync Overview

CVS Demo

Q&A
events.how_to_find_us: Come to the entrance at 415 Main Street and take the elevators up to the 2d floor to the Monadnock room.

events.name: ​The Future of Healthcare IT
events.description:
FEATURED SPEAKER
Dr. John D. Halamka is the International Healthcare Innovation Professor at Harvard Medical School and Executive Director of the Beth Israel Lahey Health Technology Exploration Center.

PRESENTATION TOPICS
Dr. Halamka has wide-ranging interests in Healthcare Information Technology. He will cover these topics:

- How can interoperability let us make better use of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence?
- How can we foster the culture of evidence-based medicine and can ML and AI help with that?
- Can we achieve the Learning Healthcare system envisioned by the National Academy of Medicine?
- How do we transition the healthcare system from the fee-for-service model to value-based care? And what is the role of IT in that transition?
- How can new technologies like blockchain help solve some of these challenges, and when are they not the right solution?

WHO SHOULD ATTEND
Anyone from academia, industry or government interested in machine learning, APIs, mobile, cloud, and internet of things in healthcare should attend this session.

SPEAKER'S BIO SKETCH
Please see details here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1zKZLiHeFYfw3BY34VjTbQstV7TdwURgk

SCHEDULE
5:30 pm - Arrive, socialize, food
6:00 pm - Announcements
6:15 pm - Presentation
7:15 pm - Q&A
7:30 pm - Networking
8:00pm - Finish

SPONSORS
Special thanks to athenahealth for the meeting space and refreshments for this event.
events.how_to_find_us: If driving, use 400 N Beacon Street, Watertown, MA in GPS. See Campus Map. Park in area P2 or P3. Enter Building A via Entrance 1.  MBTA: use #70 bus from Central Square, Cambridge. Or get ride share from Harvard Sq (3.5 mi) or from Alewife (3.6 mi)

events.name: Double Header: Serverless mobile apps with Firebase and Serverless CI/CD on GCP
events.description:
FIRST PRESENTATION
Build and scale serverless mobile apps with Firebase and Google Cloud
Doug Stevenson
Google

ABSTRACT
If your app has millions of users, you need a backend infrastructure to support its growth. Do you want to build that infrastructure? Of course not! Your time is better spent focusing on the app. In this talk, we'll take a look at the code for a mobile app that works like a “universal translator”. It uses Firebase and Google Cloud services and APIs. And we'll do it "serverless" without having to manage servers or infrastructure. A live demo of the app will be done with audience participation - bring a phone or laptop!

WHO SHOULD ATTEND: Anyone who wants to see how Firebase developers cross into Google Cloud, or Google Cloud developers who are interested in using Cloud infrastructure to power realtime mobile apps.

THE SPEAKER:
Doug is a veteran engineer, experienced public speaker, and developer advocate at Google with the Firebase team. He developed web apps before the web had "apps", and developed for Android since the very first Android device was on the market. In the SF bay area, he's bootstrapped the efforts of several startups. Outside of work, Doug follows professional ice hockey and enjoys craft beer.

SECOND PRESENTATION
Serverless CI/CD on Google Cloud Platform
Lynn Langit @lynnlangit
GDE, Cloud Architect

ABSTRACT
In this talk see the newly released GCP Cloud Build service in action. Lynn Langit will build a serverless CI/CD pipeline using Google Cloud best practices.
The pipeline will include both a Continuous Integration and a Continuous Delivery build step and will build both code and service artifacts (docker container). The pipeline will use Build Triggers to implement these features.

THE SPEAKER:
Lynn Langit is a Cloud Architect and Developer. She is a GDE for Cloud, AWS Community Hero and Azure insider. In addition to production work on data pipelines, Lynn is also an author of 30 courses on cloud and data topics for Lynda.com.

SCHEDULE:
5:30 pm - Arrive, socialize, food
6:00 pm - Announcements
6:15 pm - First presentation and Q&A
7:15 pm - Second presentation and Q&A
8:15 pm - Networking
8:30pm - Finish
events.how_to_find_us: Please enter the Broad Institute at 415 Main St, Cambridge. This is 1 block away from the Kendall/MIT station on the MBTA Red Line. Street parking in the area is very limited, with meter expirations strictly enforced. Off-street parking is expensive.

events.name: Special Event: Cloud Run + Fun Run = Cloud Run Club
events.description:
Learn about GCP's newest serverless offering, Cloud Run, and enjoy a fun run! Cool Cloud RUN SWAG to be provided. Event includes FREE hands on Cloud Run Qwiklabs in a Study Jam format.

Registration IS REQUIRED at the below link for your SWAG:
https://events.withgoogle.com/cloud-run-club-boston

Summary

There is a gap between running simple endpoints in Cloud Functions and full blown services in Google Kubernetes Engine. What if there was a service to fill this gap? There is! GCP's new Cloud Run serverless offering lets you launch a Docker container as a web service wit a single gcloud or console command. We'll learn about Cloud Run and work through Qwiklabs showcasing these features.

This is a SPECIAL EVENT. What makes it special? There will be an optional athletic component, a 3K (2 mile) fun run! Cloud Run and a Fun Run 😄.

Notes:
- bring a laptop to participate in the Qwiklab study jam
- running in the event is optional, you may hangout otherwise
- runners should bring comfortable running attire
- food will be *after* the run, rather than at the start of the event
- we'll watch your belongs back at the secure venue while you run
- you can change clothes at the venue before/after the run

Agenda

5:30 PM - 6:00 PM Check-in and meet & greet
6:00 PM - 6:45 PM - Cloud Run Presentation/Qwiklab
6:45 PM - 7:45 PM - Change and depart for RUN on Charles River
7:45 PM - 8:30 PM - Reception and networking

Speakers

Joseph Lust (@lustcoder), Software Engineer at mabl, erstwhile MC10 lead, MDDetails.com and RunPartner.com co-founder, Cloud Next speaker, and blogger.

Location

Google Campus, 355 Main St, Cambridge, MA

Sponsors

Special Thanks to Google Developer Relations and Cloud Run for providing the venue, food, and awesome Cloud Run SWAG!
events.how_to_find_us: Use the entrance off Main St next to Clover. Follow the signs to the Cloud Run Club event.

events.name: Migrating to GCP: A Startup's Journey
events.description:
SPEAKER BIO:

Jessica Janiuk is the lead software engineer at Spoiler Alert, a Boston-based tech startup focused on reducing food waste. Jessica has a full stack background and has been working in tech for the past 10 years. Her focus is web technologies, and she has a passion for good user experience. She is also the co-organizer of GDG Cambridge and a Women Techmakers Ambassador.

TITLE:

Migrating to GCP: A Startup's Journey

ABSTRACT:

A lot of thought can go into deciding on which cloud to use, and sometimes we make the wrong decision and have to migrate to another cloud platform. Come join Jessica share the story of Spoiler Alert and her team's decision to migrate from Microsoft Azure to Google Cloud Platform. She'll walk through the technology, the consoles, decisions, and migration process through all of it. Oh and Spoiler Alert! It'll be fun!

WHO SHOULD ATTEND:

Anyone interested in getting a better understanding of which cloud technologies work for them, why different technologies and clouds are picked, and how startups make decisions about which tech is the right ones.

WHAT WILL YOU LEARN:

You'll learn about how startups look at picking technologies, cloud providers, and how migration between platforms works. This talk is for all experience levels and questions are welcome.
events.how_to_find_us: Enter via the Stanley Building entrance at 75 Ames Street and proceed to the 2nd floor. Follow the signs.

events.name: Kubernetes Meetup with Kelsey Hightower
events.description:
We're excited to invite you to a Google Cloud Tech Talk: Kubernetes With Kelsey Hightower.

REGISTER: https://events.withgoogle.com/kelsey-hightower-meet-up-at-google-cambridge/

Hear from one of the leading industry experts of Kubernetes about how you can leverage Google technologies and platforms to grow your business.

Kelsey Hightower is a Principal Developer Advocate at Google working on Google's Cloud Platform. He has helped develop and refine many Google Cloud Products including Google's Kubernetes Engine, Cloud Functions, and Apigee's API Gateway. Kelsey is also a huge open source contributor and currently maintains multiple projects that aid software developers and operations professionals in building and shipping cloud native applications.

Event Details

Date/Time: Tuesday, September 17th @ 6pm
Location: Google Cambridge - 355 Main Street, Cambridge, MA

Agenda

* 6:00PM - Cocktail Hour
* 6:30PM - Keynote with Kelsey Hightower
* 7:30PM - Networking

REGISTER: https://events.withgoogle.com/kelsey-hightower-meet-up-at-google-cambridge/

events.name: Financial Markets Solutions with Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
SPEAKER: Sal Sferrazza, Cloud Solutions Architect @ Google

Two years after the Flash Crash of 2010, the Securities and Exchange Commission voted to approve a National Market System plan to create, implement, and maintain a consolidated audit trail (CAT) for the US stock markets. After a five year request-for-proposal process, in March of 2017, the firm Thesys was selected to be the technology provider among three finalists. In January of 2019, the CAT organization announced that Thesys was being released as plan processor for the CAT and that efforts were being taken over by FINRA, the administrator of the incumbent OATS system.

Hear about the CAT saga from one of the architects for FIS and Google's joint finalist bid, covering a bit of market history and a peek into the plumbing of the complex technical landscape that is the U.S. National Market System.

SPEAKER BIOGRAPHY:
With a history of building systems for the financial services industry, Sal brings a pragmatic philosophy and broad expertise to technology teams with ambitious objectives. Prior to Google, his efforts as lead architect for FIS's Consolidated Audit Trail finalist bid saw him championing secure public cloud solutions for a post-trade market surveillance repository referred to by CNBC as the “biggest database in the world”. As Solution Architect for Google’s Cloud Platform, he helps Wall Street deploy its systems safely into the public cloud.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND
Anyone interested in Financial Services Technology, Big Data or Google Cloud Platform should attend.

BACKGROUND INFORMATION
https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/pdf/FISConsolidatedAuditTrail.pdf

Also, check out this excellent episode of the GCP podcast for recent news on Google Cloud Bigtable. https://www.gcppodcast.com/post/episode-192-cloud-bigtable-with-billy-jacobson/

SCHEDULE
5:30 pm - Arrive, socialize, food
6:00 pm - Announcements
6:15 pm - Presentation
7:15 pm - Q&A
7:30 pm - Networking
8:00pm - Finish

FOOD and DRINK
Los Amigos Taqueria burritos! 🌯 🎉

SPONSORS
mabl is providing space and food for this event. (mabl has moved, please note the new address on Arch St.)
events.how_to_find_us:
Take Red or Orange lines to Downtown Crossing. You can enter 101 Arch St either from the subway platform (brass doors beyond the entrance to Roche Bros), or across from Macy's and next to Pret A Manger (brass doors).

Pay parking is available.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Extended Machine Learning Lab
events.description:
Gain ML skills with a Machine Learning Image Processing quest through Qwiklabs. We'll work through a complete quest (5 related labs) together, to learn how to train image learning models in Google Cloud. Special thanks to Qwiklabs and GDG for sponsoring these free labs and event.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND
Anyone hoping to learn about machine learning, cloud technology, and image processing. Whether you're new to ML or experienced, you'll be able to learn how to extend your skills to the cloud.

BACKGROUND INFORMATION
We'll complete this Quest: https://bit.ly/37xpbBU

Breakfast snacks/coffee and lunch will be provided. Please bring your own laptop and power adapter.

SCHEDULE
10:00 am - Arrive, socialize, food, setup
10:15 am - Start labs
12:30 pm - Lunch
3:00 pm - Wrap up
4:00 pm - Additional time for anyone still working

While 5 hours is allotted, experienced attendees may be able to complete them in 3 hours. If you require over 5 hours, organizers will be happy to stay later. We hope to help everyone successfully complete the exercises.

FOOD and DRINK
Food from Flour Bakery and coffee from George Howell Coffee.

SPONSORS
mabl is providing space, GDG the food, and Qwiklabs the (normally $25 per person) training.
events.how_to_find_us:
Take Red or Orange lines to Downtown Crossing. Please use the entrance across from Macy's and next to Pret A Manger (brass doors). If you arrive late, use the intercom next to the door to page the front desk security.

Pay parking is available.

events.name: 2019 GDG Community Holiday Party!
events.description:
Join the Boston GDG groups for a community holiday party! You've honed your tech skills through a dozen meetups this year. It's time to kick back, dine, and drink with your Boston GDG community compatriots.

To register, USE THE BELOW LINK, since this is a community (multiple Meetup group) event:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-gdg-holiday-party-tickets-84552947141

Note: this event is NOT FULL, but registration is restricted on Meetup. You must use the above link to register for this event.

RESTRICTIONS
The venue is a bar, so you must be age 21+ and bring an ID

SCHEDULE
7:00 pm - Socialize, food, drink
8:00pm - Tech gadget raffle
9:00pm - Wrap up

FOOD and DRINK
Dillons Bar

SPONSORS
A huge thanks to Google Developer Groups!

upcoming.name: Top Secret: Securing Your Cloud Secrets in GCP
upcoming.description:
Storing secrets is a perennial development problem, until now. With Google Cloud's release of Secrets Manager, you can now securely access and rotate your app secrets simply, easily, and securely without falling back to the hacks we're all too familiar with.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND
Cloud practitioners, tech peeps, and the tech curious. The lecture will be tailored to appeal to a broad, cloud minded audience.

SPEAKER INFORMATION
Lukas Karlsson (@lukwam) is a true GCP cloud maven. By day Lukas is a Cloud Architect and Developer Advocate @ the Broad Institute, watching over their large genomics cloud. By night Lukas is a Google Developer Expert, certified GCP cloud architect, Slack meetup founder, routine GCP Cloud Next presenter, and connoisseur of fine footwear and street art.

SCHEDULE
5:30 pm - Arrive, socialize, food, setup
6:00 pm - Cloud news recap and meetup update
6:15 pm - Primary talk
7:15 pm - Questions, further networking
7:30 pm - Wrap up

FOOD and DRINK
"Not Pizza" fare will be supplied, including veg/vegan options. Check back closer to the meetup date for more details on the catering selection.

SPONSORS
Special thanks to mabl for sponsoring this event
upcoming.how_to_find_us:

Pay parking is available in the area
